turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Good, you brought your violin.  I want you to play.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: It's a machine gun.  I thought I'd kill myself.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Are you lovesick?

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: Suicidal.  It's much less codependent.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Will champagne help?

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: Not enough.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Panes is here!

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: Oh great.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: She's even better looking in the flesh.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Really?  I need a drink.  Come hide with me.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Oh, Jesus, Panes.  I can't, I can't believe that bitch is in my house.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: You don't know she's a bitch.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: She's all over him, are you blind?

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: It could be worse.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: She could be playing the role in Joe's movie that should be yours.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Fuck you, Panes.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: You see, that's worse.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I just wanted tonight to be with the people we love.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: Like your business managers?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: They're not just our business managers, Panes.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: Oh, okay, forgive me.  Your neighbors are here, for fuck's sake.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Exactly what I mean.  It's all ruined.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: It's not ruined, for fuck's sake.  It's one of your parties.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I don't want it to be just one of our parties.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: "How are you really doing, Panes?" "Lousy, thank you, I'm falling apart."

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Like the last time.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: No.  No, not like the last time.  She was the rest of my life.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Like the last time.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: I wasn't finished.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: "We can't stand seeing you like this, Panes.  I hate you being alone.  Why don't you stay with us for a while?" "I'd love to, thanks."

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: It's our anniversary, Panes.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: I didn't hear me say tonight.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: We're just feeling our way back.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: "Otherwise, we'd insist on your being here."

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: You know it's true.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Everyday.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: I'm Levi Panes.  Will you excuse us, Skye?  It's time for Sally's meds.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Shit!

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: I'd cut off her red wine if I were you.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Shit.  It's my Galiano.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: What does that mean?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: About five thousand dollars.  With my discount.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: So how are you really doing, Panes?

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: Why don't you go fuck yourself?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: No.  Really.  For real.  Really.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: I'm worried about your Galiano.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: You're a shit.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: No, really, five thousand with your discount.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: How's the movie going?  Your movie.  You are making a movie, aren't you?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Yes.  Fine.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: That's it?  Yes.  Fine?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I don't want to talk about it.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I never like to talk about my work.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: Alright.  Well, that's something new.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: No.  Not something new.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: Well, something's wrong.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Nothing's wrong.  It's great, okay? Having the time of my life.  Mac's a fantastic director.  And what can anyone say about Cal that hasn't been said.  And it's great working with friends, blah blah blah.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: Um.  Happy for you.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: So tell me, how's it going?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Oh you know.  No doubts.  No second thoughts.  Am I a monster?

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: You're my best friend.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: That's not an answer, is it?

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: Yes, you're a monster.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Thank you, Panes.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: You don't need to thank me.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: We're going to have to go back out there.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: I guess.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Panes?

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: From Jewish Folk Poetry, a song cycle...

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: What did I do?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Panes is not on my team anymore.  I'll have Panes if I like.

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Well, so glad you decided to come.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Thank you.  This was so unnecessary.  I hope you've noticed that Otis isn't barking as much.  We keep him in at night.

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: At 4:30 today he barked for a solid fifteen minutes.  I have it on tape.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: You're keeping a record, are you?

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: It's just very distracting when you're trying to work.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Well the neighborhood is full of dogs, and it's not always Otis.

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: Well today it was Otis.  And you should keep him away from our yard.  Because Sheila will defend herself.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Monica and Ryan.

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: Rose.

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: I didn't know you had this.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Oh.  Well, yes.  It's extraordinary.  You think you could sign it for us?

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: Absolutely.  You always wonder where your books end up.  Why don't we use it?

turns.speaker: SKYE
turns.text: Oh my God, sorry.  I'm interrupting.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I'll be right out.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I don't think I ever spent half a day in the Beverly Center.

turns.speaker: SKYE
turns.text: Whatever, do you remember?  I've seen all your movies.  When I was in rehab, the second time, they wouldn't even let us see your drug addict movie.  They said you were too real.  I worship you.  And I couldn't be more flattered, because I know the part I'm playing in Joe's movie is based on you as a young woman.

turns.speaker: SKYE
turns.text: Happy anniversary.  Thank you for making me a part of it.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: What are they?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: You don't need to do that.

turns.speaker: SKYE
turns.text: I don't mind...

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Relax.  You've done enough.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Enough about me.

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: Evie has a little something for you.

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: Oh my God!  America told me your neighbors are coming?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: And here they are!

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: And she was saying how happy you were to finally have them over.  Because you're both, so, what - introspective?  And you should have done it ages ago.  I'm Sophia Gold.  Come meet my husband, Cal.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: He's a novelist.

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: Ah.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Like Joe.

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: Hmm.  Where are my kids?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: In the guest room.  I've laid out a paint table for them.

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: I hope they're watercolors!

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Nevermind.

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: Would you like to meet my husband?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Isn't this a fabulous picture?

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: She's such a great photographer.

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: Hm.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: So where should I put it?

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: I thought it was okay where it was.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: It's much more personal in here.

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: A notch above the storage room.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: We're always in here.  She really gets him, doesn't she?

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: The both of you.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: But she really gets to the heart of Joe, doesn't she?  She's a genius.

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: So how much do you hate her?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Big time.

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: Well, I don't trust her.  I never have.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: She took our wedding photos, for chrissakes.  You don't trust anyone.

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: I trust you.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Oh Soph...

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: You'll hate it in London.  It's wet and miserable.  A medical hellhole Sally. It's socialized.  Beds in the corridors. Terrible plumbing.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: And the food sucks, I know.

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: You are not having your baby in London. You're going to have your baby at Cedars in Beverly Hills, America, delivered by Dr. Milton Cohen.  Period. And you're getting that epidural right away, don't let anyone talk you into any of that Lamase bullshit.  There's no excuse for pain like that.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Sophia!  I'm not even pregnant!

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: Well good.  Thank God.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Let's go in the kitchen and spy on everyone.

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: Oh honey, let's.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: What do you mean, thank God?

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: Well, are you sure about this baby thing? It's not the ticking clock shit, is it?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: No, no, not at all... I mean I've still got plenty of time.  Don't I?  I mean I still have a good six years, whatever. We could have three kids yet, if we wanted.  And I know I've always said I never wanted kids, and I didn't... but this year, I really, truly, feel ready...

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: Honey, I'm not worried about you.  You are going to be a fantastic mom.  Not an issue.  I pressed you, remember?  Joe, on the other hand, is a different story.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Oh Soph, Joe loves kids.  Joe wants kids. Joe thinks he needs kids.

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: He wants playmates.  Oh he's a sweetheart, Sal, you know I love him. But he's not going to be a good father. He's just not parenting material.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Hey, let's sit down.  I bet the rug feels really nice against your skin.

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: Don't try and change the subject.  Oh God, it feels great!  He's just a little narcissistic, irresponsible and unreliable.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: And Cal's this massive adult?

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: Cal knows who he is.  Did you notice how happy Joe was when the drugs came out tonight?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: You weren't exactly horrified.

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: I don't have a drug problem.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Neither does Joe.

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: His sister does.  Big time.  And the New York Times says addiction is genetic -- I'll e-mail you the article.

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: You don't have kids to keep a marriage together, Sally.  It's only five months since Joe came back.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: We're fine.  We're great.  We're having a baby and we're moving to London.

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: Well, you weren't fine last summer when you went Sylvia Plath on me in Connecticut.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Not nice.  Not kind.

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: Ha!  Not half so not kind as your husband was in his portrayal of you in his novel.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Why are you doing this?

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: His image of you is a possessive, fragile neurotic.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: But I am a possessive, fragile neurotic.

turns.speaker: SOPHIA
turns.text: No you are not.  You're Sally Nash. Listen to me, you're Sally Nash.  You're my best friend and I love you more than anyone, and you're not going to move to London to have the offspring of a sexually ambivalent man-child.  "Oh now I'm a novelist, oh now I'm a director..." English prick bastard Joe Therrian who's probably going to leave you for Skye Davidson anyway.

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Sorry Azteca.  Here you go, fellas! Fresh dirt!  Alley oop!  Shouldn't we be wearing gloves?  I mean this dirt is very...dirty. Doesn't anyone think of hygiene?  Boy am I hungry.  I'm so hungry I'm seeing double.  It looks like there's <u>two</u> million ants in here.  When's lunch?  Tomorrow, or the day after?

turns.speaker: AZTECA
turns.text: Z, old pal...  SHUT UP!!!  It's bad enough there's a food shortage without you complaining about it every day.

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: The squeaky wheel gets the oil.

turns.speaker: AZTECA
turns.text: No, Z.  The squeaky wheel gets <u>thrown</u> <u>away</u>, alright?  You're a good ant, Z, even though you are a pain in my rear- segment.  I don't wanna see anything happen to you.  So quit mouthing off, before you get in trouble.

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Thank goodness.  Breaktime.

turns.speaker: AZTECA
turns.text: Break's over.

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: This colony needs another tunnel like a hole in the ground.  Why are we even digging this thing?

turns.speaker: AZTECA
turns.text: Who cares, Z.  All I know is, we gotta dig.  We're not the ones in charge.

turns.speaker: AZTECA
turns.text: Hey, slow it down, big boy.  You're making the rest of us look bad...How come I haven't seen you around here before?

turns.speaker: WEAVER
turns.text: I'm new...I was born yesterday.

turns.speaker: AZTECA
turns.text: Tell me about it.

turns.speaker: WEAVER
turns.text: Nobody told me digging was so much fun!  You pick up the dirt, you move it, you pick it up again, you move it again -- lots of repetitions, you exercise the forceps, and the pincers --

turns.speaker: AZTECA
turns.text: Mmm, yes, I see what you mean...

turns.speaker: AZTECA
turns.text: I don't know what came over me, talking back like that.  I must be going crazy...

turns.speaker: WEAVER
turns.text: Sorry I got you in trouble.  But listen, you can share my rations.

turns.speaker: AZTECA
turns.text: Are you asking me out to dinner?

turns.speaker: WEAVER
turns.text: No -- I mean yes -- I mean -- if you don't have other plans.

turns.speaker: AZTECA
turns.text: I'll make myself available...Listen, better watch out with the backtalk.  I don't know want you to end up like the guy who used to work next to me.  I'm afraid he got... <u>downsized</u>.

turns.speaker: AZTECA
turns.text: Wait a minute, that's no soldier -- that's Z!

turns.speaker: WEAVER
turns.text: Z?  <u>Our</u> Z?  The little guy made it!

turns.speaker: WEAVER
turns.text: You know, you're not just workers -- you can be whatever you want to be! Look at Z!  He started as a worker -- then he became a soldier!

turns.speaker: AZTECA
turns.text: That's right!  He slaughtered hundreds of termites single-handedly!

turns.speaker: WEAVER
turns.text: Well, because he's more than a worker...he's a...what did he call it, Azteca...

turns.speaker: AZTECA
turns.text: Invisible!

turns.speaker: WEAVER
turns.text: No -- an <u>individual</u>!

turns.speaker: AZTECA
turns.text: Someone who follows his heart!

turns.speaker: WEAVER
turns.text: Right...because every ant's important!

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: General -- we have to talk sometime!

turns.speaker: FORMICA
turns.text: Very well.  Carpenter, is there a convenient time to talk vis-a-vis: relationship?

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: So, um...how was your day?  What did you do?

turns.speaker: FORMICA
turns.text: Well...  I declared war!

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Oh...and I was afraid we had nothing in common...

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: He's...he's dead.  You don't have to look for him anymore.  He was eaten by a praying mantis.

turns.speaker: FORMICA
turns.text: It's a shame he died prematurely...I was hoping to kill him myself.

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Well you'll never be able to hurt him where he is now.  I miss him already.

turns.speaker: FORMICA
turns.text: You miss him?  <u>Why</u>?

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Because...because he's <u>twice</u> the ant that you are.  I could <u>never</u> go through with marrying you.  I'm -- I'm an <u>individual</u>, and when I get married, it'll be to someone <u>I</u> choose.

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: What a bunch of losers.  Mindless zombies capitulating to an oppressive system --

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Wanna dance?

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: So uh -- how come I haven't seen you around here before?

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: I work in the palace, I don't get out much.

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: The palace, hunh?  I bet those royals really live it up.  Of course they're all a little, you know, from inbreeding --

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: <u>What</u>?

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Are you sure this is a real dance?

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Well, actually, uh -- I'm sort of making it up --

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Why should everyone dance the same way?  It's as exciting as watching fungus grow.

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: You're right!

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: You -- you think I'm right?

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Why can't I just do whatever I want to do?  Why can't I just go wild?! Yahoo!

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: You watch yours, soldier, or my worker friend will beat you up!

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Oh, that's okay, I'll let him off this time.  Are you crazy?  This guy's built like a pebble!  You know they do great prosthetic antennas nowadays --

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Aren't you gonna stand up for yourself?

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Uh oh.  Goodbye!  Gotta run!

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Wait!  When can I see you again?

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Let me think.  Hmmnn...  Never.  Bye!

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: You're the hero of the recent termite campaign, aren't you?

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Well, if single-handedly vanquishing the enemy and slaughtering a whole nestful of termites makes someone a hero, yes I am.

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: And you are...?

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: I'm Princess Bala.

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Ah, yes.  Well, charmed, I'm sure.  So, Princess, have you ever danced with a hero?

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Oh...oh well then, one more won't matter.

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: No, General.  I'm dancing with the war hero.

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Uh, sorry, General, I...I've always had this animal magnetism, it --

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: You dance...

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Divinely?

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: No weirdly...You remind me of someone...

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: He was a worker.  I danced with him at a <u>worker's bar</u> just the other day. I'm not shocking you, am I?

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: No...as a matter of fact...

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: OH MY GOD, IT'S YOU!  YOU'RE A WORKER!!!  A filthy, stupid, disgusting WORKER!

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Gee, uh, could you say it a little louder, I think there are some ants in the next colony who didn't hear you.

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: I CAN'T DANCE WITH A WORKER!

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: That's not what you said the <u>other</u> <u>night</u> --

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Quiet -- sshhh!!

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: -- At the <u>worker bar</u>!  You were pretty hot to trot then!

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: SSHH!!!  SSHH!!!

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: What <u>was</u> that thing?

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: How should <u>I know</u>?

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: I order you to find out where we are!

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Alright, alright, I'll try to get directions from one of the locals.

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Excuse me, I --  Pardon me --  And they call them social insects.

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Climb up that tree and get a better view!

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: I've been kidnapped by the village idiot.

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Who's the bigger idiot -- the idiot who gets kidnapped, or the idiot who lets herself get kidnapped by the idiot?

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: How dare you speak to me like that? I'm the Princess!

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Theoretically, yes.  But is the monarchical hierarchy applicable without the underlying social structure to support it?

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Of course!  It defines society!  To deny the precept is to say that order is an arbitrary distinction applied by the society itself!

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: But can there be a society composed of just two ants?

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: No!  There's no such thing as "just two ants."  You never see just two ants -- you see a million ants!

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Look around, sweetheart.

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: I -- <u>hate</u> -- you.

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Well I guess that makes us even.

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Ha!  Don't make me laugh.  You're crazy about me!  That's why you lied and cheated to get near me!

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Oh come on, <u>you're</u> the one who came after me -- the swarthy, earthy, sensual worker!

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: I was <u>slumming it</u>!  I danced with you because you were the most pathetic specimen in the place!

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Is that the same standard you used to choose General Formica?

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: I <u>didn't</u> choose him.  What kind  of <u>idiot</u> would...  ...<u>choose</u> who she wanted to marry?

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Now, worker, you shall take me back to the colony, and have your head cut off and stuck on a sharp pole!

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Well, that's an appealing offer, but...considering the options...  You go back.  Me, I'm going to Insectopia.

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: <u>Insectopia</u>?  You stupid worker, that's just a fairy tale!

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Yeah, well I have it on a reliable source...  that it exists.  Now you follow the yellow egg...  <u>That</u> direction.

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Worker!  Come back here now!

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: I've got a <u>name</u>.  It's <u>Z</u>.

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: That's not a name!  That's just a letter!

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Water...water...

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Water...water -- oh, you already said that.

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: My skin's dry, my exoskeleton is cracking...I wish I'd never met you, you ruined my life.

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: <u>I</u> ruined <u>your</u> life?  Look, I was perfectly happy until I met you -- alright, I was miserable, but I was <u>happily miserable</u>.

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: We're going to die!

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Come on -- it's gone!  What are the chances of that happening again?

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Why didn't I listen to my mother ...why'd I have to go looking for trouble? Any ant would have given their left legs to be in my position...what's <u>wrong</u> with me?

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Want a list?

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Wait, I hear something!

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: This lake is huge!  And so close to the colony!  Think of the vacation potential!

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Cut me down a soft leaf so I can take a nap.

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Listen, "Princess", you can't order me around.  Out here, you're not the boss anymore -- out here, you're just --

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Out here I'm just what?

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Hlllllllp!

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Stop fooling around in there.

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Princess, has it ever occurred to you that they're <u>not going to rescue you</u>?

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: General Formica won't let me die out here.  I'm his fiancee.

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Look.  How many other Princesses are there?

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Five thousand three hundred and ninety -- no.  About five thousand four hundred by now.

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: And only you can become a Queen?

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Well...no, but --

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: So what makes you so special?

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Well...I <u>am</u> the oldest.

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Face it, Z, we're lost!  We must have walked halfway across the world by now!  How did I get into this mess...

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Come on...tell me there wasn't just a little...something between us that first night at the bar.  The night we danced.

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: What difference does it make...we're both going to starve to death, or get squished, or set on fire...

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: We've found it!  <u>Insectopia</u>!  Look at all this food'

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: You were right...you were right!  Z, it's <u>beautiful</u>!

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Let's dig in!

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Z...if we don't make it...I just want you to know....

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: <u>This is all your fault</u>!!!

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Come on, Z.

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Forget it.  You go ahead, I give up. I...I don't know what I was thinking. "Insectopia".

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: So...you never did tell me...what made you come out to the worker bar that night?

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Just looking for fun, adventure, trouble, I guess.

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Well, "trouble" is my middle name. Actually, my  middle name is .985, but I don't tell people.  Hey, Bala, I...I actually have something of yours...you left it at the bar that night.

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Sorry, it's been through a war, not to mention everything else...

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: You held onto this all that time?

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Well, I...I know it's a little strange, but...I thought it might come in handy if I...needed a scarf someday.  Well, to be honest, I just liked having it.

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Why do they have you tied up here?

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: There's something going on, Z --

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Bala, that -- that lake we found -- I think the tunnel's right underneath it!  -- Formica's going to <u>flood the</u> <u>colony</u>!!!  That's what he meant when said there were too many ants!

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Oh no...

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Z!  what are you doing?

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: I know it's crazy, but -- I can't just leave.  Don't argue with me.  If I've learned anything, it's that the problems of two people don't add up to a hill of ants in this world.  Or beans.  Something like that.  Anyway, I've <u>got to warn the others</u>.

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: I mean, I've got the whole package, right?  A great life, a beautiful wife, and a few kids.

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: A <u>few</u>?

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: The Club's so <u>stuffy</u>.  I want to try someplace different.

turns.speaker: HANDMAIDEN #2
turns.text: There isn't anyplace else --  Except the worker bar.

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: The worker bar!  Yes!  That's where I want to go!

turns.speaker: HANDMAIDEN #2
turns.text: We shouldn't be doing this -- it isn't proper!

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: I'm the Princess, aren't I?

turns.speaker: HANDMAIDEN #2
turns.text: Of course --

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: And do Princesses do improper things?

turns.speaker: HANDMAIDEN #2
turns.text: Of course not --

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Then if I go to the worker bar, it isn't improper.  Anyway, don't worry. No one will recognize us in our disguises.

turns.speaker: QUEEN
turns.text: Bala has always been a hopeless romantic, General.

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: It's just that -- well, I'm honored that you selected me, and everything, I just thought the marriage might go a little more smoothly if -- we had a conversation?

turns.speaker: QUEEN
turns.text: I felt the same way before I got married.  Confused.  Scared.

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: You did?

turns.speaker: QUEEN
turns.text: Yes -- but I did my duty and sorted out all those messy feelings.  The wonderful thing about ant life is that everything is arranged.  Even marriage.  You're lucky -- General Formica is a paragon of anthood.

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Yes...he's wonderful...

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Who is that idiot?

turns.speaker: QUEEN
turns.text: Darling, you must encourage the troops -- wave!

turns.speaker: QUEEN
turns.text: Bala!

turns.speaker: BALA
turns.text: Mom!

turns.speaker: BARBATUS
turns.text: You new, kid?

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: I just joined up.  But I'm quitting! I got a trial membership!

turns.speaker: BARBATUS
turns.text: Trial membership?  Kid, when you join this ant's army, you're in for the full hitch.

turns.speaker: BARBATUS
turns.text: You just stick by old Barbatus. He'll watch out for you.  Whatsamatter, kid?  Leave a girl behind?

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Yeah.  Well -- no.  She's kind of playing hard to get.  As a matter of fact, she's playing completely unattainable.  So, what's on the schedule?  A brisk walk?  a foraging expedition?

turns.speaker: BARBATUS
turns.text: No -- we're going to attack the termites!

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Attack?  But -- I hate attacking! It's so hostile!

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Well, what exactly does our platoon do?  Serve beverages?  Process paperwork?

turns.speaker: BARBATUS
turns.text: Our platoon has the best assignment of all.  We're the first into battle!

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: So we're going back for more armor, right?  I mean, these guys are from outer space, how are we supposed to beat them?!

turns.speaker: BARBATUS
turns.text: Superior numbers, kid!

turns.speaker: BARBATUS
turns.text: Don't be scared, kid.  Barbatus's got yer back.

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Maybe they went out for the evening. Let's leave them a message and head home.

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: BARBATUS!  You -- you saved my life!

turns.speaker: BARBATUS
turns.text: Don't get all sappy about it!

turns.speaker: BARBATUS
turns.text: Z!  Over here!

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Barbatus?

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Barbatus!

turns.speaker: BARBATUS
turns.text: Be honest, kid -- am I hurt bad?

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: No, no, you're...lookin' good. You've got good color in your cheeks.

turns.speaker: BARBATUS
turns.text: No -- I can see it in your eyes.  I'm a goner.  It's alright, Z.  In this ant's army, a soldier's life ain't worth a sack of fungus.  I can't feel my legs...

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Hang in there, buddy!  You can make it!  Just -- take deep breaths, I'll try and find your body -- it's gotta be around here somewhere!

turns.speaker: BARBATUS
turns.text: I wonder...what...was it all...for...

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Barbatus, hang on -- Barbatus!!

turns.speaker: BARBATUS
turns.text: Don't make my mistake, kid... don't...be a grunt...your whole life...

turns.speaker: CARPENTER
turns.text: Princess Bala, sir.  Your fiancee.

turns.speaker: FORMICA
turns.text: Princess!  You look -- outstanding. Is there anything I can do for you?

turns.speaker: CARPENTER
turns.text: Actually, sir, we're ahead of schedule.  We have thirty-six seconds available right now.

turns.speaker: FORMICA
turns.text: Outstanding.  Princess...?

turns.speaker: CARPENTER
turns.text: Fourteen-fifty hours, sir.

turns.speaker: FORMICA
turns.text: Duty calls!

turns.speaker: FORMICA
turns.text: Dammit, this tunnel is priority A-1! We can't afford <u>any delays</u> on this project!

turns.speaker: CARPENTER
turns.text: I've never seen anything like it, General, they're they're...well, look!

turns.speaker: FORMICA
turns.text: Notice the big one, holding hands with the female?

turns.speaker: CARPENTER
turns.text: Well, uh, who notices workers, sir?

turns.speaker: FORMICA
turns.text: No one should have to.  Have him brought to me.

turns.speaker: FORMICA
turns.text: What do we have on this "Insectopia"?

turns.speaker: CARPENTER
turns.text: Scattered reports, sir.  Rumors. Nothing reliable.

turns.speaker: FORMICA
turns.text: Desperate times call for desperate measures.  Get me Ant Team Six.

turns.speaker: CARPENTER
turns.text: Ant Team Six...

turns.speaker: FORMICA
turns.text: What are you doing?!  ATTACK!!  Come on, you yellow-bellies!  Don't just stand there, Carpenter! Make an example of yourself!

turns.speaker: CARPENTER
turns.text: Uh, actually, we <u>are</u> outnumbered sir...

turns.speaker: FORMICA
turns.text: So this Z...he fancies himself an individual?

turns.speaker: WEAVER
turns.text: Yeah...I mean...well...I don't know, really, sir.

turns.speaker: FORMICA
turns.text: Well now <u>you</u> haven't fallen for this silly idea of individuality, have you?

turns.speaker: WEAVER
turns.text: Oh, no, sir!

turns.speaker: FORMICA
turns.text: Good.  You're a good soldier.

turns.speaker: WEAVER
turns.text: Thank you, sir.

turns.speaker: FORMICA
turns.text: So tell me.  Where's Z?

turns.speaker: WEAVER
turns.text: I...I have no idea, sir.

turns.speaker: FORMICA
turns.text: Okay, son.

turns.speaker: FORMICA
turns.text: We know what makes an ant colony strong, don't we?  We know that no ant can be an individual.  No <u>single</u> ant matters, right?

turns.speaker: WEAVER
turns.text: That's correct, sir!

turns.speaker: FORMICA
turns.text: Not that one.  Or that one.

turns.speaker: WEAVER
turns.text: No, sir!

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Lays it on a little thick, doesn't he?  If you ask me, he's one giant bore.

turns.speaker: FORMICA
turns.text: Now I've heard a lot of scuttlebutt about a <u>food shortage</u>.  Well you boys are gonna be taken care of.  But in the meantime we're gonna eat the enemy for <u>breakfast</u>, we are gonna eat the enemy for <u>lunch</u>, and we are gonna eat the enemy for <u>dinner</u>!

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Geez, and I forgot my toothbrush.

turns.speaker: FORMICA
turns.text: Dammit, I'm proud to be an ant.  And I know each and every one of you boys will do your duty.  Dismissed.

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: No -- you -- you don't understand!

turns.speaker: FORMICA
turns.text: Damn, I'm proud of you, boy.  I wish I had a hundred ants of your caliber. The world would tremble.  Now, time for some R and R.  You're invited to the royal victory party!

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Royal victory party?  Will...will Princess Bala be there?

turns.speaker: FORMICA
turns.text: Of course.  The entire royal family will be there to honor you.

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: ONE TO NOTHING!

turns.speaker: FORMICA
turns.text: Son, you're an ant after my own heart.  A warrior.  An ant that looks death right in the face and <u>laughs</u>.

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Well, I generally just make belittling comments and snicker behind death's back.  So, tell me, fellow war-monger...do you think Princess Bala likes men in uniform?

turns.speaker: FORMICA
turns.text: Well she better -- she's engaged to one.  <u>Me</u>!

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Engaged?  As in you're getting married?

turns.speaker: FORMICA
turns.text: Affirmative.

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: So...you two are in love?

turns.speaker: FORMICA
turns.text: In love?  I'm just a plain old soldier at heart.  I'll tell you what I love -- the field -- blood -- death -- orders...and the company of other warriors.

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: Wow, what a spread -- you know, there's a food shortage in the rest of the colony.

turns.speaker: FORMICA
turns.text: Yes, and do you know <u>why</u> there's a food shortage?

turns.speaker: Z
turns.text: ...Not enough food?

turns.speaker: FORMICA
turns.text: Negatory.  <u>Too many ants</u>.  And while we soldiers go out there, and fight, and bleed, and die for the colony, the namby-pamby workers live it up back home.
